availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, student. Kentucky native. Son of Lewis Crane Pearce and Eliza A. Stockwell Pearce. Student in Maysville in 1850. Student in Maysville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 33A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 2, September 1863, p. 77 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 26, 2020).
Missouri Digital Heritage, “Missouri Death Certificates (1910-1969),” Certificate #33856, https://www.sos.mo.gov/images/archives/deathcerts/1928/192800034962.PDF (accessed May 26, 2020).
_Find A Grave, "James Lewis Pearce, Sr. (1840-1928)," Memorial 166344750, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/166344750 (accessed May 26, 2020).
